job_tasks.phrase: Analyze complex tickets escalated by AI systems, apply human expertise to areas where AI falls short, and then close the gap by improving the AI system
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the integration of human expertise with AI systems to improve the AI's performance, which falls under improving existing systems and integrating different capabilities.

job_tasks.phrase: Review AI-generated solutions and provide detailed feedback and participate in AI model fine-tuning sessions
job_tasks.justification: This directly relates to the process of improving AI models through feedback and participation in fine-tuning sessions.

job_tasks.phrase: Prototype and test new AI tools and methodologies
job_tasks.justification: Prototyping and testing new tools and methodologies are core software development activities, even when applied to AI.

job_tasks.phrase: Integrate technical human expertise and AI capabilities to deliver exceptional customer support, focusing on complex issues that AI cannot yet fully resolve
job_tasks.justification: This describes the integration of different capabilities (human and AI) to deliver a service, fitting the definition of software development and integration.

soft_skills.phrase: taking two whole months to get up to speed; you will be expected to ramp up one several products within the first month (we are aware this is aggressive)
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the expectation of rapid learning and adaptation to new products and systems.

soft_skills.phrase: if you are not adept at unblocking yourself, you will likely struggle in this role
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes the need for self-sufficiency and problem-solving skills to overcome challenges independently.

profile.rationale: The role focuses on integrating AI capabilities into customer resolution processes and improving AI systems through feedback and fine-tuning. While there's mention of AI model fine-tuning (1.B.1), the primary emphasis is on applying human expertise to areas where AI falls short and improving the AI system itself, which aligns with integrating AI into existing workflows and improving them (1.A.1). The role is not about building AI models from scratch or deep research but rather about supporting and enhancing AI-driven customer support. Therefore, it's classified as AI-Adjacent Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines responsibilities related to AI integration and improvement within a customer support context. While it mentions 'AI model fine-tuning', the overall framing suggests a role that supports and enhances existing AI systems rather than developing core AI models. The 'What you will NOT be doing' section and the emphasis on self-unblocking provide good context for the required skills. The confidence is high, but not perfect, as the term 'fine-tuning' could imply deeper ML involvement than the rest of the description suggests.
